title: 104_hr3395
content: TEMPORARY 4.3-CENT REDUCTION IN CERTAIN FUEL TAX RATES. During a temporary rate reduction period, certain fuel tax rates will be reduced by 4.3 cents per gallon. This includes rates for gasoline, diesel fuel, diesel fuel and special fuels, and certain methanol or ethanol fuels. During the temporary rate reduction period, fuel tax rates for compressed natural gas will not be taxed under section 4041(a)(3). Additionally, fuel taxes imposed during this period will have rates reduced by 4.3 cents per gallon, coordinating with highway trust fund deposits. During the temporary rate reduction period, fuel tax rates for compressed natural gas will not be taxed under section 4041(a)(3). The rates will be reduced by 4.3 cents per gallon until January 1, 1997. The amendment will take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act. SEC. 2. FLOOR STOCK REFUNDS. If tax has been imposed on liquid before the enactment of the Act and is held by a dealer for sale, the taxpayer can claim a credit or refund for the excess amount paid. Claims must be filed within 6 months of the Act's enactment with the Secretary of the Treasury. The Act allows taxpayers to claim a credit or refund for excess tax paid on liquid held by a dealer before the Act's enactment. No credit or refund is allowed for liquid held in retail stocks. Definitions for "dealer" and "held by a dealer" are based on section 6412 of the Code. Similar rules from section 6412 apply. For this section, subsections (b) and (c) of section 6412 of the Code will be applicable. SEC. 3. FLOOR STOCKS TAX. Imposition of Tax: A floor stocks tax of 4.3 cents per gallon is imposed on gasoline or diesel fuel held by any person on January 1, 1997, to which the tax applies. Liability for the tax rests with the person holding the fuel, and payment must be made by June 30, 1997. Gasoline and diesel fuel are considered "held by a person" if title has passed to them. The floor stocks tax of 4.3 cents per gallon applies to gasoline or diesel fuel held by a person on January 1, 1997. The terms "gasoline" and "diesel fuel" are defined in section 4082 of the Code. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Treasury. The tax does not apply to fuel held for exempt uses or in the tank of a vehicle. No tax is imposed on certain amounts of fuel. No tax is imposed on gasoline or diesel fuel held on January 1, 1997, by a person if the amount held does not exceed 4,000 gallons for gasoline and 2,000 gallons for diesel fuel. The person must submit required information to the Secretary. Fuel exempt from tax under subsection (d) or (e) is not considered. For tax purposes, controlled groups are treated as one person, with specific criteria outlined in the tax code. Regulations are in place for nonincorporated persons under common control. Principles similar to those in subparagraph (A) apply to a group of persons under common control, even if not all are corporations. All provisions of law applicable to taxes under section 4081 also apply to floor stock taxes imposed under subsection (a). SEC. 4. REPEAL OF BENEFITS FOR ALCOHOL FUELS. Repeal of Alcohol Fuels Credit under Section 40 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, along with corresponding conforming amendments to other sections of the Code. The table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended by striking section 40. The table of sections for part II of subchapter B of chapter 1 is amended by striking section 87. These amendments apply to taxable years beginning after the enactment of this Act. Section 4081 is amended to repeal reduced fuel tax rates for gasoline, diesel fuel, and aviation fuel. The Internal Revenue Code is amended by striking various subsections related to special motor fuels and making conforming amendments to different sections. The Internal Revenue Code is amended by redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (3) in subsection (f) of section 9503. The amendments made by this subsection will take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.
